title: Bee Hummingbird
text: The bee hummingbird is the smallest bird in the world. It measures only about 2.25 inches (5.7 centimeters) in length and weighs about 0.07 ounces (2 grams).

title: Penguin
text: Penguins are flightless birds that spend most of their lives in the water. Despite their lack of ability to fly, penguins are excellent swimmers and can reach speeds of up to 20 miles per hour (32 kilometers per hour) underwater.

title: European Robin
text: The European robin is a popular bird in folklore and is often associated with Christmas. In many European cultures, it is believed that robins are the guardians of the spirit world and bring good luck.
